description: Medical diagnosis and monitoring involves identifying health conditions and tracking patient progress over time. This is crucial for timely interventions and effective treatment plans.
you_have_this_if: You are monitoring patients with specific syndromes or conditions.
You need to assess lung function in patients who cannot perform standard tests.
You are looking for early detection methods for lung function deterioration.
You require a non-invasive method for pulmonary assessment.
You are dealing with patients with chronic respiratory diseases.

approaches.best_for: When monitoring patients with Hermansky-Pudlak Syndrome for pulmonary fibrosis and assessing lung function in patients unable to perform standard spirometry.
approaches.key_tradeoff: FOT provides a non-invasive way to assess lung function but may not be as widely validated as traditional methods.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need a non-invasive method to monitor lung function in patients who cannot perform standard tests.

start_here: The recommended first approach for most cases is the Forced Oscillation Technique (FOT) due to its non-invasive nature and applicability in specific patient populations.
